title: Wyclef Jean
summary: Nel Ust Wyclef Jean[2] (/ˈwaɪklɛf ˈʒɒ̃/; born October 17, 1969)[2][3] is a Haitian rapper, singer, songwriter and actor.[4] At the age of nine,[5] Jean immigrated to the United States with his family. He first achieved fame as a member of the New Jersey hip hop group the Fugees, alongside Lauryn Hill and Pras Michel. They released the albums Blunted on Reality (1994) and The Score (1996), the latter becoming one of the best-selling albums of all time. Jean would follow this with the release of his first solo studio album,  Wyclef Jean Presents The Carnival (1997), which contains his top ten hit "Gone till November".
